body.name: Girl With A Rose: An absolutely addictive serial killer thriller novella (Tess Winnett)
body.description: Her body is frozen, unable to move. Her eyes are locked on the blood leaving her body in a steady string of droplets, collecting in the bone ash porcelain bowl engraved with intricate gold leaves. Her parted lips let out a shriek that no one hears. He just smiles and wipes her tears with cold fingers. “Wow. I think I just fell head over heels in love with a fictional character. Tess Winnett is one of the smartest FBI agents and profilers I have come across yet and with analytical skills to rival Sherlock Holmes. Hats off to Leslie Wolfe for easily the best thriller I have read in this genre for many, many years!” – Manie Kilianon, five stars review on Amazon.The girl: missingAfter fifteen-year-old Kaylee disappears without a trace, FBI Special Agent Tess Winnett is assigned to the case that falls outside of the normal purview of the FBI. With every lead she uncovers, more questions are posed with only one possible, terrifying answer: there are others like her who have vanished, never to be seen or heard from again.Is there a pattern in these disappearances? What happened to the others who have vanished? Is there a connection, or is Tess chasing shadows?The first twenty-four hours: criticalFrantic for answers and painfully aware of each passing moment, Tess has a choice to make, one that could save the life of a young girl: was Kaylee’s disappearance a singular event, or was she the latest victim of a serial killer no one knew existed?The odds of finding the girl alive drop with every second passing by and making the wrong choice would seal her fate. Her blood would be on her hands.The best-selling author of Dawn Girl is back with another suspenseful, gripping crime thriller. If you’re a fan of David Baldacci, Melinda Leigh, and James Patterson, you will enjoy Leslie Wolfe’s enthralling police procedural that will keep you reading until the last page.What Readers and Reviewers Are Saying About Leslie Wolfe“Wolfe's strong female characters, who all appear to be flawed, never disappoint. ”“The action is immediate and nonstop, and just when you think you have it all figured out, Wolfe tosses in a twist so masterful that it’ll make your head spin. ”“Wow... Leslie Wolfe is an incredible story teller. Can't wait for more of Agent Tess Winnett.”“Leslie Wolfe has a wonderful ability to make you feel as if you were right there watching the events unfold in this fast paced and nail-biting thriller.”

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good reading
reviews.reviewText: Really love the author. Her books are different and holds your attention.. I am anxious to read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars What is it with...
reviews.reviewText: Florida and producing so many serial killers, I mean really are the odds that high? Journey with SSA Winnett as she tracks down another crazy in the heat of Miami.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased many of Ms. Wolf's books, once I start reading I don't put the book down until I finish it. I was recommended this author by Amazon. I enjoy these books because I can read them in one day. Another great thing about Ms. Wolf books, if they flow really well and are easy to follow. Also if you read them in order you won't be confused as to what is happening in the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am just zipping through these books and loving every minute of Tess. On to the next in the series!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A highly simplistic story
reviews.reviewText: This is a highly simplistic story where a very bad villain who acts very cleverly during his adolescent and adult life as a serial killer ends up being extraordinarily stupid when committing his last crime, which allows a detective superwoman despite her virtual inability to even hold a normal conversation with anyone to overcome said monster and confirm her hero status.I couldn’t go below three stars given the low price of the book and reasonable story flow and writing style, though I still wonder at this stage if the story was worth the $.99 I spent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Girl With A Rose
reviews.reviewText: It was a pretty nice story.A little short.Felt kinda rushed and hurried.But a good one none the less.I really enjoy how Quick Tess Winnett thinks on her feet!But is she ever gonna come thru one of these stories where it doesn't land her on the other side of recovering at the beginning of the next story?I mean can someone else take the ass whipping for her? LolGuess ill never know if I don't keep reading.Now on to the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thriller till the end.
reviews.reviewText: Endless drama. Story and characters were well described. As always, a must read. Highly recommend. Ended too soon but I still loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Girl With A Rose: An absolutely addictive serial killer thriller novella (Tess Winnett)
reviews.reviewText: OH MY GOODNESS!! I was captivated by this unknown author to me, and I could not read the book FAST enough! I was ONE step behind Tess all the way and I really felt sorry for the little boy whom was not loved by his parents. This is an excellent way to get to know the author!

All of her books are twisted. I mean all the killers hunted by their childhood. You get to sympathize even a little with how horrible their childhoods were and understand how that would push a fragile kids mind over the age and turn into killer. But each book is unique. This is the first one that made me cry in the end. As a mother myself, it felt deep...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 30, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I did really enjoy this, though I rarely give novellas 5* as I just don't like them much. However, this author made instalments 5, 6 and 7 all shorts in this series so if I wanted to keep reading I had to cave in. I love the series but I'm pleased to see book 8 is back to a PROPER length novel at long last !!It was an intriguing tale as Tess tried to locate a girl who'd disappeared that has a connection to her boss, making it a doubly stressful job this time out !! I recently read a book featuring a 14 year-old teenage girl and was shocked at how much of a gullible nitwit she was......and in this story this one is the same but a year older !! I just don't recall ever being THAT naive or trusting when I was their age, nor any of my pals.And, I know it is a short book but I didn't spot a single mistake, and that's a proper "whoop, whoop" moment for this reader, as it so rarely happens !! Someone called Joni Wilson is mentioned as the editor at the end of the book and the first novella was also tremendously presented, so if she is the reason I hope she sticks around. I have instalment 7 downloaded so have to sit through another "half a book" but at least I know number 8 is one to really look forward to.
Typical riveting Wolfe story, but I found the ending was a bit rushed. It didn't detract from the story but I would have liked more of it to finish with as the rest was so good.
Leslie Wolfe does it again. Excellent plot, excellent writing and the super FBI agent Tess Winnett is excellent. What a perfect way to get your mind off all our current problems for a few hours.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: I wish it had been longer......
reviews.reviewText: Completed I. A day and a bit, thoroughly enjoyed it, wish it had been longer, more detail about the mother and father’s take on it in the younger years
